resources.string: Starting in version 2.0, uSticker now comes with a standalone keyboard. In order to use uSticker, please enable the keyboard in the system settings.\n\n(For uSticker 1.x users, Google removed custom sticker support in Gboard 10.2, so we were forced to create our own keyboard. Sorry for the inconvenience.)

Copy your images to the configured storage location, then press the import stickers button. Your images will then show up in the keyboard.

Have too many stickers to scroll through? Put your stickers in sub-directories, and we\'ll generate a new sticker tab for each.

Only PNG, JPG, GIF, BMP, and WebP files are supported. Any files or directories with a name starting with . are ignored.

2.0.0
uSticker now comes with its own keyboard. Removed Gboard support and Firebase dependencies.

1.6.0
Added an option to sort stickers by alphabetical order.

1.5.4
Gboard now limits you to 100 stickers per pack, so added a validation check for that. Also removed the bug report button as it was encouraging spam.

1.5.3
Removed unused storage permission. Fixed incorrect sticker count calculation.

1.5.2
No longer crashes when failing to find a file browser app. Also added a button to make reporting bugs easier.

1.5.1
Changed sticker keywords (for search) to be Unicode-aware.

1.5.0
Use Storage Access Framework to select sticker directory. This means you can now import stickers from an external SD card. Also removed support for Android 4.4.

1.4.4
Fixed crash if the configured sticker directory does not exist. Also reworded some text to be more understandable.

1.4.3
Fixed index refresh failing if you have a lot of stickers. Again.

1.4.2
Added support for WebP images.

1.4.1
Fixed a bug that caused the app to crash when requesting storage permissions on some phones.

1.4
Disabled the sneaky Firebase analytics that were enabled by default.

1.3
Added support for Android 4.4 through 6.0.

1.2
No longer fails if you have over 1000 stickers. Seriously though, why do you have over 1000 stickers?!

1.1
You can now search for stickers in Gboard! Keywords are generated from the sticker file and parent directory names.

1.0
Initial release.
Press after adding or removing stickers
An unknown error occurred while importing stickers. If you would like to help improve uSticker, please submit an issue on GitHub using the button below. Thank you!\n\n%1$s
Select a new directory to search for stickers
Switch back to the previous keyboard after selecting a sticker
Could not read stickers; please re-select the sticker directory
Cannot find an app that supports ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT_TREE. If you disabled the built-in Android file browser, please re-enable it to use uSticker.
Details copied to clipboard. Please submit an issue on GitHub.
